Sajīvāna，（nt．） at S．I，44 is metric spelling for sa-jīvana [sa2=saṁ，+jīvana] “same livelihood，” in phrase kiṁsu kamme s．“what is （of） the same livelihood in work，i．e．occupation?” The form is the same as jīvāna at J．III，353．Taken wrongly as Gen．pl．by Mrs．Rh．D．in trsln （K．S．I．63）：“who in their work is mate to sons of men?” following Bdhgh’s wrong interpretation （see K．S．I．321） as “kammena saha jīvantānan； kammadutiyakā nāma honti．” （Page 668）
